definition: pros and cons/advantages and disadvantages/gains and losses
to do harm to/to cause trouble to/harm/evil/calamity
see 不知好歹[bu4 zhi1 hao3 dai3]

sentences.english: Shi Xing pain Chen interests, points out the consequences of the Japanese occupation of Korea will bring.
sentences.chinese: 石星痛陈利害，指出了日军占领朝鲜会带来的恶果。

sentences.english: There is no conflict of fundamental interests among third world countries.
sentences.chinese: 第三世界国家之间没有根本的利害冲突。

sentences.english: The emerging world has a big stake in the European crisis.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲危机和新兴国家利害攸关。
这是一种很利害的手段。

sentences.english: In this suggestion, I target two kinds of potential stakeholders. One is sponsor;
sentences.chinese: 本建议案中，我将目标锁定为两群潜在的利害关系者。

sentences.english: The interest at stake of the intervenor appellant and the administrative appeal.
sentences.chinese: 二参加人与本诉愿之利害关系。

sentences.english: Mr Luo has a lot at stake.
sentences.chinese: 新规则对雒海超有很大的利害关系。

sentences.english: This means that you have a stake in the development and prosperity of the wider world.
sentences.chinese: 这就是说，全世界的发展与繁荣对中国利害攸关。

sentences.english: Don't build me up too much;
sentences.chinese: 别把我捧得太利害，我可能令你失望。

sentences.english: He was found on the morning of the first day in his room downstairs helpless with pain.
sentences.chinese: 发病那天上午人家在楼下他的房间里发现他疼得利害。

sentences.english: This last deception will be worse than the first.
sentences.chinese: 这样，那后来的迷惑，比先前的更利害了。

sentences.english: Not with so much at stake.
sentences.chinese: 我们有太多的利害攸关。

sentences.english: Too much is at stake if we fail.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们失败，涉及的利害关系太大。

sentences.english: "Logos He goes on. "But logos," he writes, " "serves to reveal the advantageous and the harmful.
sentences.chinese: 也继续写到，主要是为展露出利害关系。

sentences.english: I was still balancing the matter in my mind .
sentences.chinese: 我心里正在权衡利害得失。

sentences.english: For us to take part in the discussion would be a conflict of interest.
sentences.chinese: 我们要是参加讨论，就会造成利害冲突。

definition: lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
to advance or retreat/knowing when to come and when to leave/a sense of propriety
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
that being the case/then/in that case
clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
